Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw and label a land habitat and a water habitat clearly, such as a garden and a pond.
The student can illustrate and label different types of living things for each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes for the land habitat and fish and plants for the pond.
The student can make comparisons between the two habitats, showing differences in the living things found in each, like comparing trees to aquatic plants.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally miss labeling some of the less obvious living things, such as ants in the garden or clams in the pond (incomplete labeling).
The student might not fully elaborate on distinct patterns of diversity, such as variety in plant sizes or animal types, across the two habitats (minor gaps in explanation).
